name: terminal-focus-hook
description: Run a script or send text when the active terminal changes (focus/activation).

commands.title: Terminal Focus Hook: Run Hook Now (Active Terminal)

terminalFocusHook.scriptPath.markdownDescription: Path to a script to run when a terminal becomes active. Defaults to `$HOME\Set-CtmEnv.ps1`. If the script is a PowerShell `.ps1`, it's invoked via `pwsh` (falling back to Windows PowerShell). The extension will also extract the text in the last parentheses of the terminal name (e.g. `CTM AAPI (hor-143)` => `hor-143`) and pass it as the first argument.

terminalFocusHook.sendText.markdownDescription: Instead of an external script, send this text into the activated terminal (press Enter automatically). Leave blank to skip.

terminalFocusHook.matchTerminalName.markdownDescription: Optional JavaScript RegExp (without slashes), e.g. ^CTM AAPI or CTM|API. Only run when the activated terminal's name matches.

terminalFocusHook.debounceMs.description: Minimum time between runs per terminal name to avoid double triggering during rapid UI changes.

terminalFocusHook.runOnStartupActive.description: Also run for the terminal that is already active when the extension loads.
